welcomeMessage: A modern, mobile-first Travel Itinerary Web App for a trip to Shanghai and Hong Kong.
day1_event2_desc: Take Maglev & Metro Line 2 to East Nanjing Rd. Station.
day1_event3_desc: Stroll along the waterfront, enjoy the classic skyline view.
day1_event4_desc: Yunnan folk cuisine with a fantastic atmosphere.
day1_event_home_to_airport_desc: Depart from home to the airport.
day1_event_airport_lounge_desc: Enjoy a quiet moment with snacks and drinks before boarding.
day1_event2_title_new: Maglev to Longyang Rd & Blacklane Transfer
day1_event2_desc_new: Maglev to Longyang Rd Station -> Blacklane transfer to hotel.
day1_event2a_desc: Take the Maglev train from Pudong Airport.
day1_event2b_desc: Private car transfer from Longyang Rd Station to the hotel for check-in.
day1_event3_desc_new: For the first night in Shanghai, click here for late-night snack options to kick off your culinary journey.
resto_xysj_desc: Classic Shanghai pan-fried buns with a thin, juicy skin and crispy bottom.
resto_anm_desc: A nostalgic noodle shop serving local favorites; the yellow croaker noodle is a must-try.
resto_laohuzhao_desc: Traditional wontons cooked over a wood fire, with a delicious and authentic broth.
resto_dingtele_desc: Open 24/7, famous for its yellow croaker noodles with pickled greens and various congees.
resto_fuchun_desc: A local favorite for soup dumplings (xiao long bao) at an affordable price.
resto_erguang_desc: Legend says the wontons are so good you wouldn't stop eating even if slapped. Famous for cold wontons.
resto_honglin_desc: A popular late-night spot specializing in crayfish and barbecue.
resto_haidilao_desc: Famous for its exceptional service and wide variety of hot pot options.
resto_longmen_desc: Offers authentic Sichuan cuisine, perfect for those who love spicy food.
resto_xiangmanlou_desc: A Shanghainese restaurant serving a variety of classic local dishes until late.
resto_dahu_desc: Different from Xiao Yang's, uses traditional leavened dough for a fluffier texture.
resto_shukeman_desc: An old-school eatery known for its vegetable rice and bone soup.
resto_wanghong_desc: A simple yet delicious chicken rice, an excellent choice for a late-night meal.
resto_changjiao_desc: A late-night noodle shop that attracts many diners with its rich broth.
resto_barbarian_desc: A gastropub offering creative grilled meats and cocktails in a relaxed atmosphere.
resto_shaguowang_desc: Famous for its various hot and steaming clay pot dishes, perfect for a winter night.
resto_fengsheng_desc: Offers Taiwanese-style late-night snacks like braised pork rice and salt and pepper chicken.
resto_haigefan_desc: Specializes in Spanish paella, with generous ingredients.
resto_xiaoman_desc: Offers Hunan-style rice noodles, sour and spicy to whet the appetite.
resto_laowang_desc: A hot pot restaurant famous for its rich pepper and pork stomach chicken broth.
resto_xibei_desc: Offers Northwestern Chinese cuisine, such as grilled lamb chops and oat noodles.
resto_saizeriya_desc: An extremely affordable Italian family restaurant.
resto_pizzamarzano_desc: A pizza chain from the UK, offering a variety of pizza flavors.
resto_bluefrog_desc: An American-style bar and grill, famous for its burgers and Monday's buy-one-get-one-free deal.
resto_tacobell_desc: Offers Mexican-style fast food like tacos and burritos.
resto_charlies_desc: Known for its pink burger buns and creative burger flavors.
resto_popeyes_desc: A fried chicken chain from Louisiana, USA.
resto_kyochon_desc: A famous fried chicken brand from South Korea, offering various flavors.
day2_event1_title_new: Yu Garden & City God Temple (豫園及城隍廟)
day2_event1_desc_new: Step into a classic Ming Dynasty garden, admire the exquisite pavilions, and savor various traditional Shanghai snacks in the bazaar.
day2_event2_desc_new: Experience a sensory feast that combines visual and culinary arts with a unique business lunch.
maglev_step1_desc: Please present the E-ticket (6-digit voucher code or QR code in the SMS from Trip.com) at a self-service ticket machine to pick up your physical ticket(s).
maglev_pickup1_desc: Self-service ticket machines at the ticket office of Longyang Road Maglev Train Station, No. 2100 Longyang Road. Pick-up time: 06:45~21:30.
maglev_pickup2_desc: Self-service ticket machines at the ticket office of Pudong Terminal 1 & 2 Station. Pick-up time: 07:02~21:40.
maglev_usage_desc: The Round-trip ticket is valid for 7 days. If you haven't received the SMS, please call Trip.com customer support. If you need an invoice, please request it from the staff at the exit gate.
day2_event3_desc_new: Wander through Shanghai's unique Shikumen alleyways, discovering creative shops, art studios, and handmade crafts.
day2_event4_desc_new: In a stylish district blending old and new, click here for dinner options and enjoy an elegant Shanghainese meal.
resto_yhz_desc: An exquisite Shanghainese restaurant; their braised pork in brown sauce is a signature dish.
resto_xjb_desc: Offers classic Shanghai home-style cooking in a cozy atmosphere.
resto_jwb_desc: A Michelin-recommended high-end Cantonese restaurant with excellent food and ambiance.
resto_hakkasan_desc: A modern, high-end Cantonese restaurant with a stunning river view.
resto_uv_desc: The world's only multi-sensory restaurant, with three Michelin stars. Reservations must be made months in advance.
resto_mr&mrsbund_desc: A modern French restaurant by a celebrity chef, with a chic atmosphere and amazing night views.
resto_yongfoo_desc: A Michelin-starred restaurant hidden in an old villa, specializing in exquisite Shanghainese cuisine.
resto_sichuancitizen_desc: Offers authentic Sichuan dishes and creative cocktails in a lively atmosphere.
resto_colca_desc: A restaurant blending Peruvian and Spanish flavors, perfect for lovers of exotic cuisine.
resto_goodfellas_desc: A cozy and authentic Italian restaurant serving handmade pizzas and pastas.
resto_polux_desc: A French bistro by a celebrity chef, with a relaxed atmosphere and relatively affordable prices.
resto_daisytang_desc: Specializes in creative Asian fusion cuisine in a beautiful setting.
resto_elbodegon_desc: An Argentinian steakhouse offering high-quality steaks and South American wines.
resto_lostheaven_desc: A Yunnan specialty restaurant with exotic decor and a fantastic atmosphere.
resto_commune_desc: A modern tapas bar by celebrity chef Jason Atherton, serving creative small plates.
resto_jean-georges_desc: A renowned Michelin-starred French restaurant at Three on the Bund.
resto_ottoemezzo_desc: A three-Michelin-starred Italian restaurant offering a top-tier dining experience.
resto_fuhehui_desc: A Michelin-starred vegetarian restaurant that elevates vegetarian cuisine to an art form.
resto_mercatobyjg_desc: Also at Three on the Bund, offering casual Italian cuisine.
resto_unibrown_desc: A Latin-style lounge and restaurant that transforms into a lively nightclub.
resto_barrouge_desc: One of the most famous bars on the Bund, with an excellent terrace view.
resto_captain_desc: A bar on the rooftop of The Captain Hotel, with great views and relatively affordable prices.
resto_epiceriefab_desc: A French bistro and bakery offering authentic French light meals.
resto_cantondiscoy_desc: Located in The Shanghai EDITION, offering innovative Cantonese cuisine and a disco atmosphere.
resto_shanghaitavern_desc: Also in The Shanghai EDITION, offering modern British cuisine.
resto_theshed_desc: An Australian-style pub serving hearty burgers, pies, and beers.
resto_liquidlaundry_desc: A creative space combining a microbrewery, restaurant, and laundromat concept.
resto_shake_desc: A retro-style soul music bar with live band performances and creative cocktails.
resto_sobercompany_desc: One of Asia's 50 Best Bars, divided into a cafe, restaurant, and bar.
day2_event_cruise_desc: Enjoy the dazzling night views of the Bund and Lujiazui. Click here for ticket redemption and boarding instructions.
cruise_step1_desc: Customer service will contact you via WhatsApp/WeChat in the afternoon to confirm the final departure time and pier.
cruise_step2_desc: Please arrive near Shiliupu Pier 2 or 3 at least 45 minutes before the departure time provided by customer service.
day2_event_get_tickets_desc: Meet the staff near the pier as instructed by customer service to collect your physical paper tickets.
cruise_step3_desc: Find the staff according to the location image sent by customer service to collect your physical paper tickets. E-vouchers are not accepted for boarding.
day2_event5_title_new: The Bund Night View (外灘夜景)
day2_event5_desc_new: Enjoy the spectacular Pudong skyline light show from a prime vantage point on the North Bund or Riverside Avenue.
day3_sub_event1_desc: Stroll along the ancient town's stone-paved roads, exploring the iconic Fangsheng Bridge and the bustling old street.
day3_event3_desc: In the ancient water town, click here for lunch options featuring river delicacies and local farm-style dishes.
resto_apcl_desc: A rustic teahouse by the river, offering simple farmhouse dishes and tea.
resto_juyuan_desc: An old-time restaurant in Zhujiajiao, serving authentic local dishes and river delicacies.
resto_helong_desc: Known for its braised pork and various farmhouse dishes at affordable prices.
resto_yunjian_desc: A restaurant with a better environment, offering refined local cuisine.
resto_maolao_desc: A famous snack stall in the ancient town, with crispy outside and tender inside stinky tofu.
resto_zongzi_desc: Sold in many small shops, it's one of the specialty snacks of Zhujiajiao.
resto_tangyuan_desc: Handmade sweet dumplings available in various flavors.
resto_sanwan_desc: An interestingly named tavern where you can taste local yellow wine.
resto_yijia_desc: Popular among tourists, offering a variety of river delicacies and farmhouse dishes.
resto_shuyuan_desc: A space that combines dining and culture with a tranquil environment.
resto_laojie_desc: Another well-known tangyuan shop, famous for its traditional flavors.
resto_nongjia_desc: There are many in the ancient town, allowing you to experience authentic farmhouse flavors.
resto_hebian_desc: Dine while enjoying the scenery of the water town.
resto_kuaile_desc: Sells various fried foods and local snacks.
resto_caibing_desc: A specialty snack of the ancient town, crispy and delicious.
resto_haishitang_desc: A traditional sweet pastry shaped like a begonia flower.
resto_qingtuan_desc: Glutinous rice balls made with mugwort juice, available with various fillings.
resto_mahu_desc: There are many handmade mahua (fried dough twist) shops in the ancient town.
resto_longxusu_desc: A traditional folk candy made by pulling maltose into fine threads.
resto_doufu_desc: Silky smooth tofu pudding, available in sweet and savory versions.
resto_zhuti_desc: Braised pig's trotters, a local specialty.
resto_zharou_desc: Braised pork wrapped in lotus leaves, rich but not greasy.
resto_yanshui_desc: Simply boiled river shrimp, fresh and delicious.
resto_baoyu_desc: Steamed white fish is a local specialty dish.
resto_chaomian_desc: Many small restaurants in the ancient town offer home-style fried noodles.
resto_jiuniang_desc: A sweet dessert with a hint of alcohol, warm and nourishing.
resto_geng_desc: A seasonal aquatic plant, eaten after being boiled.
resto_liansong_desc: A glutinous rice cake specialty from the nearby Liantang ancient town.
resto_chaye_desc: A simple snack found in many small shops.
day3_event_rest_desc: Take a short break at the hotel to recharge before the evening activities.
day3_event6_desc: In the bustling Jing'an district, click here for dinner options and taste exquisite Jiangsu-Zhejiang cuisine.
resto_nanlu_desc: An elegant restaurant serving creative Jiangsu-Zhejiang cuisine, suitable for dates or business.
resto_guimanlong_desc: A themed restaurant with a Southern Song Dynasty ambiance, offering cost-effective Hangzhou dishes in a lively atmosphere.
resto_orange_desc: A high-end hot pot from Taiwan, known for its fresh ingredients and excellent service.
resto_fuchunji_desc: Specializing in Fujian cuisine, 'Buddha Jumps Over the Wall' is its signature dish.
resto_lelescargot_desc: A cozy French bistro offering classic French dishes.
resto_wagas_desc: Offers healthy salads, sandwiches, and juices, perfect for a light meal.
resto_calix_desc: An American-style diner serving burgers, steaks, and a variety of cocktails.
resto_elementfresh_desc: Another well-known chain restaurant for healthy light meals.
resto_baker&spice_desc: Offers European-style bread, pastries, and brunch.
resto_din_desc: An internationally acclaimed specialty store for xiao long bao.
resto_charcoal_desc: A Japanese Yakiniku restaurant offering high-quality grilled meat.
resto_pelikan_desc: A Nordic-style restaurant with creative dishes.
resto_laojishi_desc: Another famous Shanghainese restaurant, popular among celebrities.
resto_jingan_desc: Offers a variety of traditional Shanghai noodles.
resto_green&safe_desc: An organic concept store combining a supermarket and a restaurant.
resto_brut_desc: Known for its creative sandwiches and wine.
resto_stone_desc: A restaurant offering high-quality dry-aged steaks.
resto_funkadeli_desc: An Italian-style deli and bar with a lively atmosphere.
resto_cantina_desc: Offers Mexican food and a wide selection of tequilas.
resto_union_desc: One of Asia's 50 Best Bars, offering creative cocktails.
resto_speaklow_desc: A speakeasy bar hidden behind a bar tool shop.
resto_elochoco_desc: A Spanish-style cocktail bar with a cozy atmosphere.
resto_logan_desc: Known for its large, shareable bowls of punch.
resto_bar_desc: One of the first whiskey bars in Shanghai.
resto_jazz_desc: The most famous jazz club in Shanghai.
day3_event7_desc: After dinner, take a walk along West Nanjing Road to feel the city's fashionable pulse and browse high-end malls like Jiu Guang and Kerry Centre.
day4_event1_desc: Take a leisurely stroll through the French Concession, snap photos in front of the iconic Wukang Mansion, and enjoy the afternoon in a specialty coffee shop.
day4_event2_desc: In the French Concession, click here for lunch options and enjoy a relaxing meal.
resto_egg_desc: A well-known brunch spot famous for its creative egg dishes.
resto_rac_desc: An industrial-style coffee shop offering delicious crepes and coffee.
resto_blaz_desc: Offers creative dishes cooked over charcoal fire, with a great atmosphere.
resto_omer_desc: Known for its artisanal bread and healthy brunch options.
resto_sunflour_desc: A well-known bakery offering a variety of European-style breads and desserts.
resto_fine_desc: A Japanese-style cafe offering exquisite desserts and drinks.
resto_franck_desc: An authentic French bistro with a romantic atmosphere.
resto_hulu_desc: Offers creative Asian fusion cuisine, popular with young people.
resto_if_desc: A cafe with a strong design sense, perfect for photos.
resto_peet_desc: A specialty coffee chain from the United States.
resto_arabica_desc: A minimalist-style cafe from Japan, known for its high-quality coffee beans.
resto_luneurs_desc: A bakery famous for its ice cream and French bread.
resto_seesaw_desc: One of the pioneers of specialty coffee in China.
resto_manner_desc: A local Shanghai coffee chain known for its high value.
resto_grinder_desc: Offers high-quality burgers and meat dishes.
resto_lafarine_desc: Once one of the most popular French bakeries in Shanghai.
resto_bor_desc: A restaurant offering modern Nordic cuisine.
resto_bo_desc: A creative Chinese restaurant by Hong Kong celebrity chef Alvin Leung.
resto_taian_desc: A three-Michelin-starred restaurant offering an innovative seasonal menu.
resto_villa_desc: A French restaurant in an old villa with a beautiful garden.
resto_azabuya_desc: Offers Japanese Azabu Sabo-style desserts and light meals.
resto_chili_desc: A chain restaurant offering American Tex-Mex style dishes.
day4_event3_title: West Nanjing Rd Quality Lifestyle Shopping
day4_event3_desc: In Shanghai's bustling business district, click here for quality goods recommendations perfect for moms.
shop_jiuguang_desc: A large Japanese-style department store. The basement supermarket is great for imported foods and souvenirs.
shop_loccitane_desc: A natural skincare brand from Provence, France. Their hand creams are a star product.
shop_muji_desc: A Japanese lifestyle brand. Find minimalist-designed household goods, stationery, and clothing.
shop_citysuper_desc: A premium lifestyle specialty store offering quality food and household products from around the world.
shop_ole_desc: Another high-end supermarket, great for buying imported goods and souvenirs.
shop_heytea_desc: A famous new-style tea brand in China. Try their cheese-topped tea.
shop_lego_desc: A paradise for LEGO fans, with many exclusive products and experience zones.
shop_gentlemonster_desc: A designer eyewear brand from South Korea, with artistic store designs.
shop_aesop_desc: An Australian skincare brand known for its unique botanical formulas and minimalist packaging.
shop_diptyque_desc: A French fragrance brand offering high-quality perfumes, candles, and body care products.
shop_nikoand_desc: A Japanese lifestyle editorial store selling apparel, general goods, and furniture.
shop_beast_desc: A high-end art-life brand that started as a flower shop, offering home goods, fragrances, and gifts.
shop_harmay_desc: A warehouse-style beauty concept store where you can find a variety of cosmetics and skincare products.
shop_icicle_desc: A high-end Chinese eco-friendly commuter fashion brand with simple designs and quality materials.
shop_shangxia_desc: A Chinese luxury brand backed by Hermès, blending traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
shop_goyard_desc: A French luxury leather goods brand, known for its classic Y-print.
shop_moynat_desc: A historic French luxury leather goods brand.
shop_delvaux_desc: The oldest luxury leather goods brand in the world, from Belgium.
shop_lelabo_desc: A perfume brand from New York, offering on-site blending services.
shop_acne_desc: A Swedish fashion brand known for its minimalist designs and smiley face logo.
shop_thom_desc: An American fashion brand known for its signature four-bar design.
shop_ami_desc: A French fashion brand known for its heart-A logo.
shop_comme_desc: The fashion brand of Japanese designer Rei Kawakubo.
shop_yohji_desc: The eponymous brand of Japanese designer Yohji Yamamoto.
shop_isseymiyake_desc: The eponymous brand of Japanese designer Issey Miyake, known for its pleated designs.
shop_baobao_desc: A bag brand under Issey Miyake, known for its geometric patterns.
day4_event4_desc: Experience the vibrant atmosphere of one of China's most famous commercial streets. Click here for recommended fast-fashion brands.
shop_zara_desc: A world-renowned fast-fashion brand. Find the latest clothing trends.
shop_uniqlo_desc: Offers high-quality basic apparel. This flagship store features multiple floors of shopping space.
day4_event5_desc: Near the bustling pedestrian street, click here for dinner options.
resto_laolao_desc: Serves authentic Shanghai home-style dishes at affordable prices.
resto_shen_desc: A century-old shop famous for its various pastries and dim sum, also serving light meals.
resto_yanyun_desc: An old-time restaurant famous for its Peking duck.
resto_laosheng_desc: A chain of soup dumpling restaurants offering various flavors of soup dumplings and noodles.
resto_nanjing_desc: Offers a variety of Nanjing specialty snacks in a lively, market-like atmosphere.
resto_xiaozao_desc: Serves authentic Shanghainese dishes; braised pork and stir-fried shrimp are recommended.
resto_wangbaohe_desc: An old-time restaurant famous for its crab feasts, one of the best places to enjoy hairy crabs.
resto_dexing_desc: A century-old shop famous for its braised pork knuckle noodles.
resto_gongdelin_desc: A famous vegetarian restaurant offering imitation meat dishes.
resto_meixin_desc: Offers authentic Cantonese dim sum and dishes.
resto_taoyuan_desc: A soy milk and fried dough stick shop from Taiwan with an artistic vibe.
resto_heytea_desc: Take a break from shopping with a cheese-topped tea.
resto_lelecha_desc: Another popular new-style tea shop, known for its fruit teas and soft European-style bread.
resto_starbucks_desc: One of the largest Starbucks stores in the world, offering a unique coffee experience.
resto_peking_desc: A century-old Peking duck restaurant from Beijing.
resto_firstfood_desc: A large food store where you can buy various Shanghai specialties and snacks.
resto_taikang_desc: Another well-known food store, famous for its pastries.
resto_zhenlao_desc: An old brand famous for its fresh meat mooncakes.
resto_guangming_desc: Famous for its fresh meat mooncakes and cooked food, with long queues all year round.
resto_hongzhang_desc: A halal restaurant famous for its mutton hot pot.
resto_xiaoshaoxing_desc: An old brand famous for its white cut chicken.
resto_wufangzhai_desc: A famous zongzi shop from Jiaxing.
resto_ningbo_desc: Famous for its handmade sweet dumplings.
resto_laopai_desc: A street food, crispy and delicious scallion pancake.
resto_shengjian_desc: Besides Xiao Yang's and Da Hu Chun, there are many other sheng jian shops worth trying.
resto_m&m_desc: The flagship store of M&M's, full of fun.
resto_disney_desc: Located in Lujiazui, a must-visit for Disney fans.
resto_popmart_desc: A trendy toy store where you can buy various blind boxes.
day5_event_lounge_desc: Unwind and enjoy snacks and beverages in the VIP lounge before your flight.
day5_event3_desc: Check-in: Eco Tree Hotel Causeway Bay.
day5_event4_title: Dinner at Wah So Cafe (華嫂冰室)
day5_event4_desc: For your first meal in Hong Kong, savor the authentic flavors of a local 'cha chaan teng', famous for its signature pineapple buns and rich milk tea.
day5_event_bakehouse_desc: Head to the Causeway Bay branch to buy the super popular caramel egg tarts as souvenirs or a late-night treat.
day6_event2_desc: Before leaving, click here for breakfast options and indulge in one last hearty Hong Kong-style meal.
resto_kamfung_desc: Famous for its signature pineapple buns and chicken pies, a classic spot in Wan Chai.
resto_tsuiwah_desc: A chain of 'cha chaan teng' offering a wide variety of classic Hong Kong dishes.
resto_joyhing_desc: A Michelin-recommended roast meat shop; the char siu is a must-try.
resto_australia_desc: A legendary 'cha chaan teng' famous for its scrambled eggs and steamed milk pudding, often with long queues.
resto_capital_desc: Another popular 'cha chaan teng', known for its black truffle scrambled egg toast.
resto_lanfong_desc: The originator of 'silk stocking' milk tea, offering classic Hong Kong snacks.
resto_timhowan_desc: The world's cheapest Michelin-starred restaurant, famous for its baked BBQ pork buns.
resto_congee_desc: A Michelin-recommended congee shop, with a delicious fish broth base.
resto_bakehouse_desc: A very popular bakery; its sourdough egg tarts are a must-buy.
resto_honolulu_desc: An old-school bakery famous for its flaky egg tarts and coffee.
resto_yatloke_desc: A Michelin-starred roast goose specialty shop, with crispy skin and tender meat.
resto_kaukee_desc: Famous for its beef brisket in clear soup and curry, a popular spot in Central with long queues.
resto_singheung_desc: A 'dai pai dong' (open-air food stall) in Central, known for its tomato and beef macaroni and crispy lemon honey bun.
resto_mak_desc: A traditional Cantonese wonton noodle shop, famous for its small and exquisite wontons.
resto_fourseasons_desc: A famous pot rice restaurant in Yau Ma Tei, full of 'wok hei'.
day6_sub_event4a_title: To Hong Kong Station & In-town Check-in
day6_event4_desc: Metro to Hong Kong Station -> In-town Check-in -> Airport Express to HKG.
